title: Riot How Do I Prevent this behavior!!!
body:
I pick Sett to start the draft and then my  teammate bans Sett and says nothing! This was the second game in a row my own teammates banned the champ i picked.  In the second game the guy locked in teemo jungle with heal and ghost as his summoner spells.  I wish I could show you the chat but in the end I get punished because this is ranked and I dont want to waste a game with a clear troll!.  I told the team I would take the hit and dodged.  How can you report people for this when in the end they basically screw me over because now I have to wait X mins instead a taking a clear loss.  Please help! Thank you

Janumba

replies.body: Anyone can ban any champion for any reason. This is how draft pick works. If you've decided that you can ONLY play the champion you wanted to play before you even went into queue, then please do your teammates a solid and don't play ranked.

Again expanding on what Gatekeeper said, those reasons aren't necessarily trolling. Even if you're first pick, they might have a (very selfish and/or dumb) reason that isn't trolling.

This choice is not one that will be taken away.

To be quite fair, I don't like playing with a Sett on my team - it has nothing to do with the player's skill (or lack thereof, I don't even look at that *ever* in champ select). It simply is that Sett has absolutely no synergies with *my* playstyle. I'll always attempt to engage the player before outright banning Sett - but if I start to ask how they play Sett, how they plan to synergize with other lanes, etc - and they either don't respond or it becomes clear they are playing Sett for the "KDA factor" of easy KDA but lack of teamwork, then damn right I'm going to ban it away from them.

dude wtf you talking about? first of all if you ban someone teamate champ is just because you had poor feed back withhim on previous game, and you want to avoid it. 

dude im french canadian you think I can describe you my gameplay in 10 second ? before you ban it , are you delusional. 

stop inventing some bullshit

Which is, of course, a very selfish reason to ban first pick Sett. You're forcing him to adapt instead of adapting yourself.

Edit: Mind you, not throwing salt on that reason. It's a valid reason.

I disagree that it's very selfish - what is selfish is the player refusing to discuss with their team in champion select. If they provide any semblance of willingness to work with the team, I won't ban it on them. I'm not some asshat that just enjoys doing it - but at the same time if they are showing every indication they will be anti-team when they play a champion whose kit arguably encourages such play, then I'm not letting that happen in the game.

I consider that a service to my team as a whole - to prevent a selfish player from making the game basically a 4v5 for the "lolz of playing sett".

sooooo if we're making a collaborative painting using one brush each, and the first person goes to pick up a broad brush, and you ask him how he plans to the use the brush and he shrugs, you slap the brush out of his hand and say "get a different brush. I can't work with that. we'll all be better off if you pick a different brush."

yeeaap, not selfish at all... then again you just said not *very* selfish. suppose it might only be selfish.

Well, consider it more like this: Let's say that the first user picks up a paint roller (big one), and plans to paint the background brown - as in the entire canvas. The other 4 people who are making that painting don't want brown as a background color - but we don't know what he plans to do with it. So we ask him. He doesn't respond to us or he confirms that he won't be doing what we think is appropriate.

How did you get from

>To be quite fair, **I** don't like playing with a Sett on my team - it has nothing to do with the player's skill [â€¦]. It simply is that Sett has absolutely no synergies with **my** playstyle.

to this in the analogy

>The other **4** people who are making that painting don't want brown as a background color - but **we** don't know what he plans to do with it. So **we** ask him. He doesn't respond to **us** or he confirms that he won't be doing what **we** think is appropriate.

Don't you think it's a bit cheap to start out your argument highlighting that it's your personal choice, and then when it comes to the negative effects of that choice you start looking at it as if it was decision by the whole team?

As Nightsky said said: Whether it's a valid reason or not (even though I personally disagree) what you described initially is certainly a selfish decision.

Are you seriously saying there's a large contingent of players who think teamwork is not necessary? Sure, it's my personal choice to ask and ban - but are you seriously saying it isn't common sense that in a team game, teammates will expect and want teamwork from their teammates?

But whether they're a teamplayer or not is clearly not the point of your ban. It's not like they'll suddenly be exchanged for a different player if they don't get to pick Sett.

You are merely **using** their lack of teamwork as a justification for your personal choice. And all of that, it would seem, without actually asking what your other teammates want.
Also, picking Sett ain't like picking a paint roller...

I always pre-pick a champion that i dont want to play againts , that way if my team decides to troll me they actually doing me a favour.
{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}

How to Get Two Bans

- Hover {{champion:17}} or {{champion:157}} 
- Ban a different champ
- Profit
I've done that too. Does this constitute some sort of proof that League is running rampant with trolls?

Play blind if you want a specific champion. Play draft/ranked if you want to be able to ban champions/have your champion banned. Its literally the design of the game mode. As far as troll picks, Riot would have to implement a defined meta game that forces certain champion/rune combinations. That probably wont happen, but I'd be curious as to what they would allow. 

They could also implement a system that doesnt allow you to ban a hovered champ, but then that hover would basically be like you locking in your champ lol. Might as well just have "other team" bans  but I have a feeling that would just create a meta of counter bans, where if you ban sett, the other team will also ban sett because they might think youre gonna pick him since you banned them. 

OR there could be a system where you just cant ban hovers. But then what if you switch your hover every 2 seconds? Idk how that would work exactly. What if youre last pick and you want kassadin, but im playing anivia mid and cant ban him, but enemy mid picks first and goes kassadin. Id be pretty pissed lol. I dont like that idea. 

I think just ban whatever you want is the best way. If it happens often to you, then youre playing a popular champ and thats just something youre gonna have to deal with. Play one of the other 150 champs lol. If you think the bans are malicious, stop hovering your pick and no one can purposely fuck you over.
You could try not maining a character that is pretty much Perma banned on entry into champion select.

Well it wasn't just that he banned Sett.  It really had nothing to do with Sett to me to be honest. I just knew it was a troll when he ban my character said nothing then locked in teemo jungle with no smite.  I'm not playing a ranked game with a Jung with no smite so that is why I dodged and wished I could report.

And the gatekeeper I've read your posts all your do is play devils advocate and argue so I personally disagree.  You make a lot of assumptions assuming I can only play one champ. I will play rank if I want to play rank thank you.
